pageContext.claim: “[Congressional leaders] should have pushed it faster. They should have pushed it harder. And they didn't, they didn't. If they would have, it would have been a little bit better.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump blames congressional leaders for his own mistake. His fiscal 2019 budget called for $1.6 billion for barrier construction. Congress agreed to that amount, and then lawmakers were shocked when Trump rejected it, saying it was far less than he wanted. That led to the lengthy government shutdown.
